source.title: Pricing Psychology for Tattoo Artists: Stop Leaving Money on the Table
source.author: Gabe Ripley

slides.title: The Pricing Mindset Shift
slides.subtitle: You're Not Selling Hours — You're Selling Transformation
keyPoints: 73% of tattoo artists undercharge by 30% or more
Clients value outcomes, not time spent
Your 10 years of skill is built into every piece

stats.label: avg rate increase after mindset shift

slides.title: Tiered Pricing That Works
keyPoints: Small pieces (2-3 hours): Flat rate, minimum $300
Large pieces (full day+): Project rate, quote per design

slides.title: Handling 'That's Too Expensive'
keyPoints: Don't apologize or justify — explain VALUE
"This is a custom piece that will be on your body forever"
If they can't afford you, refer them — don't undersell yourself

slides.title: Action Steps This Week
keyPoints: Write down your current rates for small / medium / large
Compare to 3 artists at your skill level in your market
If you're below average, raise by 20% for new clients starting next month
Set up a deposit system (Square, TattooNOW Booking, or Venmo)
Practice saying your new rate out loud until it feels natural

content.presenterNotes: This is the educational backbone of the pricing episode. Deliver with authority — you wrote this blog post. Reference the stats confidently. After the 'Action Steps' slide, ask the guest to react: 'Nikko, does this match your experience?'
